channel.title: Science : NPR
channel.description: The latest health and science news. Updates on medicine, healthy living, nutrition, drugs, diet, and advances in science and technology. Subscribe to the Health & Science podcast.

channel.itunes:summary: The latest health and science news. Updates on medicine, healthy living, nutrition, drugs, diet, and advances in science and technology. Subscribe to the Health & Science podcast. http://www.npr.org/sections/science/

item.title: Trump's Nominee To Be USDA's Chief Scientist Is Not A Scientist
item.description: September 4, 2017 - Sam Clovis has a doctorate in public administration, is skeptical that humans have a role in climate change and pushed theories suggesting former President Barack Obama was born in Kenya.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 4, 2017 - Sam Clovis has a doctorate in public administration, is skeptical that humans have a role in climate change and pushed theories suggesting former President Barack Obama was born in Kenya. http://www.npr.org/2017/09/04/547934012/trumps-nominee-to-be-usdas-chief-scientist-is-not-a-scientist

item.title: Get Off The Couch Baby Boomers, Or You May Not Be Able To Later
item.description: September 4, 2017 - If you sit too much during middle age — at work and at home — your ability to exercise or even walk in late decades is at risk, a study hints. And, of course, your risk of heart disease climbs, too.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 4, 2017 - If you sit too much during middle age — at work and at home — your ability to exercise or even walk in late decades is at risk, a study hints. And, of course, your risk of heart disease climbs, too. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/09/04/547580952/get-off-the-couch-baby-boomers-or-you-may-not-be-able-to-later

item.title: Coca-Cola Offers A Sweet Quest: A Million Bucks To Replace Sugar
item.description: September 4, 2017 - The company is holding a contest to find a new and natural, low-calorie sweetener. The challenge comes at a time when many Americans are cutting back on sugar due to obesity and diabetes risks.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 4, 2017 - The company is holding a contest to find a new and natural, low-calorie sweetener. The challenge comes at a time when many Americans are cutting back on sugar due to obesity and diabetes risks. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/09/04/547315191/coca-cola-offers-a-sweet-quest-a-million-bucks-to-replace-sugar

item.title: Fall Weather Headed Your Way? Time For Flu Shots
item.description: September 4, 2017 - The American Academy of Pediatrics reminds us that shots — not a nasal spray — are the most effective way to protect kids 6 months and older against the flu.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 4, 2017 - The American Academy of Pediatrics reminds us that shots — not a nasal spray — are the most effective way to protect kids 6 months and older against the flu. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/09/04/547916216/fall-weather-headed-your-way-time-for-flu-shots

item.title: 'American Space Ninja' Back On Earth After Record-Breaking Flight
item.description: September 3, 2017 - Peggy Whitson smashed multiple records after spending a total of 665 days in orbit over the course of her career.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 3, 2017 - Peggy Whitson smashed multiple records after spending a total of 665 days in orbit over the course of her career. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/09/03/548295156/-american-space-ninja-peggy-whitson-back-on-earth-after-record-breaking-flight

item.title: The Bumblebee Hunter
item.description:
September 3, 2017 - The Franklin bumblebee is so small and hard to track that it's not clear if it's gone extinct. We tag along as one man makes his annual trek to try to find it.
- http://www.npr.org/2017/09/03/548255852/the-bumblebee-hunter
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 3, 2017 - The Franklin bumblebee is so small and hard to track that it's not clear if it's gone extinct. We tag along as one man makes his annual trek to try to find it. http://www.npr.org/2017/09/03/548255852/the-bumblebee-hunter

item.title: Here Are The Facts About North Korea's Nuclear Test
item.description: September 3, 2017 - North Korea has claimed to have tested a hydrogen bomb, which is far more powerful than an atomic bomb. Experts think they may have pulled it off.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 3, 2017 - North Korea has claimed to have tested a hydrogen bomb, which is far more powerful than an atomic bomb. Experts think they may have pulled it off. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/09/03/548262043/here-are-the-facts-about-north-koreas-nuclear-test

item.title: Pets Deserve Evidence-Based Medicine, Too, Says The SkeptVet
item.description: September 3, 2017 - Veterinarian Brennen McKenzie writes The SkeptVet, a blog that pushes for evidence-based medicine instead of relying on tradition, anecdotes or pseudoscience in the treatment of cats and dogs.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 3, 2017 - Veterinarian Brennen McKenzie writes The SkeptVet, a blog that pushes for evidence-based medicine instead of relying on tradition, anecdotes or pseudoscience in the treatment of cats and dogs. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/09/03/547420275/pets-deserve-evidence-based-medicine-too-says-the-skeptvet

item.title: Has Salt Gotten An Unfair Shake?
item.description: September 3, 2017 - For years, we've been told that less salt is better. But some scientists say that the world's universal seasoning has been maligned and that moderate salt intake is healthier for many people.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 3, 2017 - For years, we've been told that less salt is better. But some scientists say that the world's universal seasoning has been maligned and that moderate salt intake is healthier for many people. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/09/03/547827356/has-salt-gotten-an-unfair-shake-sodium-partisans-say-yes

item.title: Houston Shelter Offers Respite For Pets And Their Owners Displaced By Harvey
item.description: September 2, 2017 - Before a convention center opened its doors and volunteer care to pets, their owners had to make a tough choice: Take shelter or stay with animals in floodwaters. But anxiety looms around what's next.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 2, 2017 - Before a convention center opened its doors and volunteer care to pets, their owners had to make a tough choice: Take shelter or stay with animals in floodwaters. But anxiety looms around what's next. http://www.npr.org/2017/09/02/547855336/houston-shelter-offers-respite-for-pets-and-their-owners-displaced-by-harvey

item.title: A Bipartisan Bill Helped Save Pets From Harvey, And Maybe Their Humans Too
item.description: September 2, 2017 - In the aftermath of Hurricane Harvey, many people who lost their homes to flooding were able to save their pets. NPR's Scott Simon reflects on the importance of those relationships.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 2, 2017 - In the aftermath of Hurricane Harvey, many people who lost their homes to flooding were able to save their pets. NPR's Scott Simon reflects on the importance of those relationships. http://www.npr.org/2017/09/02/547972616/a-bipartisan-bill-helped-save-pets-from-harvey-and-maybe-their-humans-too

item.title: Early Data From Harvey Shows Epic Flooding
item.description:
September 1, 2017 - Government flood maps may need to be redrawn following Harvey. That, in turn, could have implications for insurers.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/09/01/547992600/early-data-from-harvey-shows-epic-flooding
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: Countries Pledge To Recover Dwindling Pacific Bluefin Tuna Population
item.description: September 1, 2017 - The long-term agreement would aid fish stocks that have fallen to just 2.6 percent of their historic size. The news comes at a time when Atlantic bluefin populations are also rebounding.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 1, 2017 - The long-term agreement would aid fish stocks that have fallen to just 2.6 percent of their historic size. The news comes at a time when Atlantic bluefin populations are also rebounding. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/09/01/547903557/countries-pledge-to-recover-dwindling-pacific-bluefin-tuna-population

item.title: Texas Expedites Help From Out-Of-State Health Care Providers
item.description: September 1, 2017 - As the medical and mental health needs of people affected by Harvey become apparent, Texas has made it easier for out-of-state health workers to come lend a hand.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 1, 2017 - As the medical and mental health needs of people affected by Harvey become apparent, Texas has made it easier for out-of-state health workers to come lend a hand. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/09/01/547816150/texas-expedites-help-from-out-of-state-health-care-providers

item.title: The Divisive Diet of Honeybees: Why Some Will Never Be Royals
item.description: September 1, 2017 - That stings! A new study suggests that fragments of plant genetic material in the pollen-rich diets of worker bee larvae ensures that they never grow up to be queens.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: September 1, 2017 - That stings! A new study suggests that fragments of plant genetic material in the pollen-rich diets of worker bee larvae ensures that they never grow up to be queens. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/09/01/547601291/the-divisive-diet-of-honeybees-why-some-will-never-be-royals
